conclusion: The particle moves from point A to point C along two semi-circular arcs with radius 1m.
The circumference of a full circle with radius R is 2πR, so the length of one semi-circular arc is πR.
The total distance traveled by the particle is 2π meters.
Displacement is the straight-line distance from A to C along the horizontal axis.
The displacement is the diameter of the circle, which is 2 meters.
The particle takes 5 seconds to travel from A to C.
Average speed is calculated as total distance divided by total time, resulting in approximately 1.26 m/s.
Average velocity is calculated as displacement divided by total time, resulting in 0.4 m/s.
Final Answer: Average Speed is 1.26 m/s and Average Velocity is 0.4 m/s towards the east.
